com.github.maxstupo.flatengine.hgui

Class AbstractNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.maxstupo.flatengine.hgui.AbstractNode
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractAlignableGuiNode, GuiContainer

    public abstract class AbstractNode
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the base of a GUI node, all GUI components are derived from this class.
    Author:
    Maxstupo

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean isVisible
      True if this GUI node will be rendered along with all children of this node.
      protected AbstractScreen screen
      The screen that owns this GUI node.

    • Constructor Summary

      AbstractNode(AbstractScreen screen, float localX, float localY, int width, int height)
      Create a AbstractNode object.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AbstractNode add(AbstractNode node)
      Adds a child node to this node, this method calls onAdded(AbstractNode), notifies the parent node of a change via onChildNodeChange(AbstractNode) and notifies all children nodes via onParentNodeChange(AbstractNode).
      AbstractNode bringToFront(AbstractNode node)
      Brings the given node to the end of the children node list within this node.
      void dispose()
      Calls the onDispose() method for both this node and all children nodes.

      Returns the height of the parent node or the height of the screen if the parent node is null.

      Returns true if isVisible() is true and setEnabled(boolean) has been set to true.

      Returns true if this node will be kept within the parent node.

      Returns true if the mouse clicked the given button over the given rectangle bounds.

      Returns true if the mouse was released when over this node.

      Returns true if the mouse was released when over the given rectangle bounds.

      Returns true if this node is visible.

      This method is called when a child node is added to this node.

      This method should unregister all events and/or listeners.

      AbstractNode removeChildren()
      Removes all children nodes from this node.

      Render the node.

      Renders both this node and all children nodes.

      This method is called after both this and all child nodes are rendered.

      Sets this node as enabled.

      Requests that renderFirst(Graphics2D) be called to recalculate variables dependent on the graphics context.

      Sets the height of this node.

      Sets if this node will be kept within the parent node, if this node has no parent the game screen dimensions will be used instead.

      Sets the local position of this node, if the given x and y values are the same as the ones already set this method does nothing.

      If set true the local position will be a percentage of the parent dimensions.

      • screen

        protected final AbstractScreen screen
        The screen that owns this GUI node.

      • isVisible

        protected boolean isVisible
        True if this GUI node will be rendered along with all children of this node.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractNode

        public AbstractNode(AbstractScreen screen,
                    float localX,
                    float localY,
                    int width,
                    int height)
        Create a AbstractNode object.
        Parameters:
        screen - the screen that owns this node.
        localX - the local x position.
        localY - the local y position.
        width - the width of this node.
        height - the height of this node.

    • Method Detail

      • renderFirst

        protected void renderFirst(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Called once before render(Graphics2D) and after all child nodes have had this method called as well.
        This method can be requested to be called next render using setGraphicsCalculationsDirty().

        This method shouldn't draw anything, it should just use the graphics context to calculate variables (e.g. the dimensions of a string).

        Parameters:
        g - the graphics context.

      • update

        protected abstract boolean update(float delta,
                                  boolean shouldHandleInput)
        Update the node and logic.
        Parameters:
        delta - the delta time.
        shouldHandleInput - true if this node should handle input (e.g. mouse clicks).
        Returns:
        true if the next node should handle input.

      • render

        protected abstract void render(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Render the node.
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics context to draw to.

      • onResize

        protected void onResize(int width,
                        int height)
        Called whenever this node changes size.
        Parameters:
        width - the new width of this node.
        height - the new height of this node.

      • onDispose

        protected void onDispose()
        This method should unregister all events and/or listeners.

        The method is called when the GUI object is no longer needed (e.g. when the screen changes).

      • onAdded

        protected void onAdded(AbstractNode node)
        This method is called when a child node is added to this node.
        Parameters:
        node - the node that was added.

      • onRemoved

        protected void onRemoved(AbstractNode node)
        This method is called when a child node is removed from this node.
        Parameters:
        node - the node that was removed.

      • onChildNodeChange

        protected void onChildNodeChange(AbstractNode instigator)
        This method is called when a child node changes local position, size, or adds / removes a node.
        Parameters:
        instigator - the node that caused this event.

      • onParentNodeChange

        protected void onParentNodeChange(AbstractNode instigator)
        This method is called when A parent node changes local position, size, or adds / removes a node.

        Note: This method does not just get triggered from changes to the parent of this node, but can be triggered by other parent nodes within this tree branch.

        Parameters:
        instigator - the node that caused this event.

      • renderPost

        protected void renderPost(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        This method is called after both this and all child nodes are rendered.
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics context to draw to.

      • renderAll

        public void renderAll(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Renders both this node and all children nodes.
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics context to draw to.

      • updateAll

        public boolean updateAll(float delta,
                         boolean shouldHandleInput)
        Updates both this node and all children nodes. In order of first added first updated.
        Parameters:
        delta - the delta time.
        shouldHandleInput - should the first node handle input (e.g. mouse button). This will be true most of the time when calling this method from a non GUI node (e.g. AbstractScreen).
        Returns:
        true if the next node should handle input. This return value can be ignored if calling this method from a non GUI node (e.g. AbstractScreen).

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Calls the onDispose() method for both this node and all children nodes.

      • bringToFront

        public AbstractNode bringToFront(AbstractNode node)
        Brings the given node to the end of the children node list within this node. This allows changing the render order of children nodes.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to bring to the front.
        Returns:
        this object for chaining.

      • add

        public AbstractNode add(AbstractNode node)
        Adds a child node to this node, this method calls onAdded(AbstractNode), notifies the parent node of a change via onChildNodeChange(AbstractNode) and notifies all children nodes via onParentNodeChange(AbstractNode).
        Parameters:
        node - the node to add.
        Returns:
        this object for chaining.

      • remove

        public AbstractNode remove(AbstractNode node)
        Removes a child node from this node, this method calls onRemoved(AbstractNode), notifies the parent node of a change via onChildNodeChange(AbstractNode) and notifies all children nodes via onParentNodeChange(AbstractNode).
        Parameters:
        node - the node to remove.
        Returns:
        this object for chaining.

      • getGlobalPosition

        public Vector2i getGlobalPosition()
        Returns the global position of this node based on the parent position and the local position of this node.

        If usePercentagePositions() is true the local position represents a percentage of the parent dimensions, if this node has no parent the game screen dimensions are used.

        This method will calculate the position when this node is dirty (set by setPositionDirty()), else it will return the previous calculated value.

        Returns:
        the global position of this node. The vector object is cached and reused.

      • getLocalMousePosition

        public Vector2i getLocalMousePosition()
        Returns the local mouse position for this node.
        Returns:
        the local mouse position for this node. The vector object is cached and reused.

      • setLocalPositionX

        public AbstractNode setLocalPositionX(float x)
        Sets the local x position of this node.
        Parameters:
        x - the local x position.
        Returns:
        this object for chaining.
        See Also:
        setLocalPosition(float, float)

      • setLocalPositionY

        public AbstractNode setLocalPositionY(float y)
        Sets the local y position of this node.
        Parameters:
        y - the local y position.
        Returns:
        this object for chaining.
        See Also:
        setLocalPosition(float, float)

      • setWidth

        public AbstractNode setWidth(int width)
        Sets the width of this node.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of this node.
        Returns:
        this object for chaining.
        See Also:
        setSize(int, int)

      • setHeight

        public AbstractNode setHeight(int height)
        Sets the height of this node.
        Parameters:
        height - the height of this node.
        Returns:
        this object for chaining.
        See Also:
        setSize(int, int)

      • setLocalPosition

        public AbstractNode setLocalPosition(float x,
                                     float y)
        Sets the local position of this node, if the given x and y values are the same as the ones already set this method does nothing.

        This method will notify the parent node of a change via onChildNodeChange(AbstractNode) and will notify all children nodes via onParentNodeChange(AbstractNode).

        If isKeepWithinParent() is true the given x and y values will be clamped to keep this node within the parent node.

        Parameters:
        x - the local x position.
        y - the local y position.
        Returns:
        this object for chaining.

      • setSize

        public AbstractNode setSize(int width,
                            int height)
        Sets the size of this node, if the given width and height values are the same as the ones already set this method does nothing.

        This method will notify onResize(int, int) and will notify the parent node of a change via onChildNodeChange(AbstractNode) and will notify all children nodes via onParentNodeChange(AbstractNode).

        Parameters:
        width - the new width of this node.
        height - the new height of this node.
        Returns:
        this object for chaining.

      • setGraphicsCalculationsDirty

        public AbstractNode setGraphicsCalculationsDirty()
        Requests that renderFirst(Graphics2D) be called to recalculate variables dependent on the graphics context.
        Returns:
        this object for chaining.

      • setPositionDirty

        public AbstractNode setPositionDirty()
        Notifies both this node and all children nodes to update the global position next time getGlobalPosition() is called.
        Returns:
        this object for chaining.

      • isMouseOver

        public boolean isMouseOver()
        Returns true if the mouse is over this node.
        Returns:
        true if the mouse is over this node.

      • isMouseOver

        public boolean isMouseOver(java.awt.Rectangle bounds)
        Returns true if the mouse is over the given rectangle bounds.
        Parameters:
        bounds - the rectangle to check if the mouse is within it.
        Returns:
        true if the mouse is over the given bounds.

      • isMouseClicked

        public boolean isMouseClicked(int buttonCode)
        Returns true if the mouse clicked the given button over this node.
        Parameters:
        buttonCode - the mouse button code to check is down.
        Returns:
        true if the mouse clicked the given button over this node.

      • isMouseUp

        public boolean isMouseUp(int buttonCode)
        Returns true if the mouse was released when over this node.
        Parameters:
        buttonCode - the mouse button code to check is up.
        Returns:
        true if the mouse was released when over this node.

      • isMouseUp

                         int buttonCode)

        Parameters:
        bounds - the rectangle to check if the mouse is within it.
        buttonCode - the mouse button code to check is up.
        Returns:
        true if the mouse was released when over the given rectangle bounds.

                              int buttonCode)
        Returns true if the mouse clicked the given button over the given rectangle bounds.
        Parameters:

        buttonCode - the mouse button code to check is down.
        Returns:

      • getBounds

        public java.awt.Rectangle getBounds()
        Returns the rectangle bounds of this node. The rectangle object is cached and is recalculated upon calling this method.
        Returns:
        the rectangle bounds of this node.

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Returns true if isVisible() is true and setEnabled(boolean) has been set to true.

        If this node has a parent node it must be enabled for this method to return true.

        Returns:
        true if isVisible() is true and setEnabled(boolean) has been set to true.

      • setUsePercentagePositions

        public AbstractNode setUsePercentagePositions(boolean usePercentagePositions)
        If set true the local position will be a percentage of the parent dimensions. Calling this method will preserve the previous local position by converting it to either a percentage or a pixel position.
        Parameters:
        usePercentagePositions - true to use percentage positions.
        Returns:
        this object for chaining.

      • removeChildren

        public AbstractNode removeChildren()
        Removes all children nodes from this node.
        Returns:
        this object for chaining.

      • getParentWidth

        public float getParentWidth()
        Returns the width of the parent node or the width of the screen if the parent node is null.
        Returns:
        the width of the parent node or the width of the screen if the parent node is null.

      • getParentHeight

        public float getParentHeight()
        Returns the height of the parent node or the height of the screen if the parent node is null.
        Returns:
        the height of the parent node or the height of the screen if the parent node is null.
